basic.name: David
basic.biography: Electrical engineer with a strong focus on data science. Junior researcher with experience implementing neural networks and publishing in international conferences, mainly about generative models. Passionate about entrepreneurship, self-improvement and acquiring new knowledge. Open-minded and always willing to help.

experience.description: Working on anomaly detection with normalizing flows under the supervision of Dr. Joan Serrà.

education.name: MSc. Telecommunications Engineering
education.description: The Telecommunications Engineering master's degree of UPC is a 2-year program which grants the status of the Spanish regulated profession of telecommunications engineer. Among its advantages, it highlights the fact that you can specialize in many different fields of knowledge. In my case, I chose the multimedia intensification, which includes courses such as Machine Learning, Computer Vision or Advanced Human Language Technologies. I obtained a scholarship to work on the voice processing department doing research on generative models under the supervision of Dr. Antonio Bonafonte and Santiago Pascual.

education.name: BSc. Telecommunications Technologies and Services Engineering
education.description: The Telecommunications Technologies and Services Engineering bachelor's degree of UPC is a 4-year program which grants the status of the Spanish regulated profession of technical telecommunications engineer. In the first two years, I acquired knowledge about mathematics, physics, electronics and programming. On the third and fourth year, I took advanced courses on digital communications and signal processing, ending up with a specialization in audiovisual systems. Courses taken in the specialization included image and video processing, speech and audio processing, audiovisual content compression, acoustics and pattern recognition. I obtained the mention of excellence, granted to those students who passed all the subjects in the first attempt without failing.

awards.name: Hackathon Mobility 2018 - First Place of the SEAT Challenge
awards.description: The challenge consisted of helping SEAT to improve driving user experience using a camera robot and Amazon Alexa to simulate a real car assistant. Our solution included functionalities such as face detection and recognition, facial expression recognition, alarm system for nearby events and the self-designed algorithm to find the best moment to refuel the car depending on predicted travels. The prize was €2000.

publications.title: Problem-Agnostic Speech Embeddings for Multi-Speaker Text-to-Speech with SampleRNN
publications.abstract: In this paper, we first use SampleRNN to create the acoustic model of a two-stage text-to-speech system. Then, we compare the performance of classical one-hot embeddings against the use of previously-extracted acoustic embeddings using a problem-agnostic encoder. Our results show that the use of our embeddings increase convergence and, most important, we are able to perform a first approximation of speaker adaptation using the latent space without model fine-tuning.
